questions.question_text:
A company wants to define a central data protection policy that works across AWS services for compute, storage, and database resources.

Which AWS service will meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
backup

Selected Answer: C
AWS Backup
• Fully-managed service to centrally manage and automate backups across
AWS services
• On-demand and scheduled backups
• Supports PITR (Point-in-time Recovery)
• Retention Periods, Lifecycle Management, Backup Policies, …
• Cross-Region Backup
• Cross-Account Backup (using AWS Organizations)

Selected Answer: C
C. AWS Backup

C. AWS Backup

AWS Backup is a fully managed backup service that makes it easy to centralize and automate the back up of data across AWS services in the cloud as well as on-premises. With AWS Backup, you can configure backup policies and monitor backup activity for AWS resources in one place. This includes compute resources like EC2 instances, storage resources like EBS volumes, and database resources like RDS databases.
Given Answer is correct
keyword - categorize = tag

Selected Answer: A
A. Cost allocation tags

Selected Answer: A
A. Cost allocation tags

Cost allocation tags enable you to categorize and track your AWS costs. When you apply tags to your AWS resources (such as EC2 instances or S3 buckets), AWS generates a Cost and Usage Report that includes usage and costs aggregated by tags. This allows you to allocate costs across your organization's business categories, making it easier to track and manage your AWS spending by project, department, application, or any other business-relevant dimension

questions.question_text:
A company needs to categorize and track AWS usage cost based on business categories.

Which AWS service or feature should the company use to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
AWS DataSync
• Move large amount of data from on-premises to AWS
I can not find this concept "AWS DataSync" in the CLF-C02 exam guide ???

comments.content: Some of the questions have terms that aren't in the exam objectives but they may come up on the test, like "site-to-site VPN" and "AWS Snowmobile"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
AWS DataSync works in 3 cases: 1. Transfer data between on premises and AWS; 2. Transfer data between AWS storage services; 3. Transfer data between AWS and other locations. 
https://aws.amazon.com/datasync/
I think the answer is correct?

questions.question_text: Which AWS service can migrate data between AWS storage services?

choices.C: AWS offers increased speed and agility.
choices.D: AWS is responsible for patching the infrastructure.
choices.E: Users benefit from economies of scale.
choices.A: Users can trade fixed expenses for variable expenses.
choices.B: Users can deploy all over the world in minutes.

questions.question_text: Which statements represent the cost-effectiveness of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
A. Users can trade fixed expenses for variable expenses.
E. Users benefit from economies of scale.

Selected Answer: AE
A&E : cost benefit is the key.

Selected Answer: AE
AE, because the D even though is a benefit, the focus of the question is about cost

Selected Answer: AE
A. Users can trade fixed expenses for variable expenses.
E. Users benefit from economies of scale.

Selected Answer: AE
Variable expenses are when you only pay for what you need so you don't pay extra for things you're not using.
Economies of scale are what allow for the pay-as-you-go pricing model of AWS

Selected Answer: DE
should be DE
I think it must be DE

questions.question_text:
A company wants to design its cloud architecture so that it can support development innovations, and continuously improve processes and procedures.

This is an example of which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
the keywords are : continuously improve processes and procedures"
"support development innovations". so the answer is operational excellence

Selected Answer: C
C. Operational excellence

Selected Answer: C
C : Operational excellence
